turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: That's all right, miss, don't worry. We're used to it - like doctors.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: There you are, miss, your receipt for the letters.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Well, I've got it when you want it, miss.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Here we are. You'll be all right here, Miss.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Thank you, you have been so kind. Anna moves down to stand CL of Paine.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Well, I'll be saying good night. Good night, Miss.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I was a friend of Harry Lime.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I would very much like to meet you, Baron. Come around.

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: Austrians aren't allowed in your hotel. Couldn't we meet at the Mozart cafe?

turns.speaker: BARON
turns.text: I'll carry a copy of one of your books. Harry gave it to me.

turns.speaker: RUSSIAN
turns.text: This is forgery. It is very clever.

turns.speaker: RUSSIAN
turns.text: We are interested in this case. Have you arrested the girl?

turns.speaker: RUSSIAN
turns.text: Please keep this passport to yourself, until I make some inquiries, will you, Major?

turns.speaker: RUSSIAN
turns.text: Can I have that woman's passport?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: You've had a bit of a shock, haven't you? You could do with a drink.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Could you buy me one. I haven't got any Austrian kroners. Thanks.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Back in school. Never so lonesome in my life till he showed up.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: When did you see him last?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: See much of him before that?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: I'm afraid I've never heard of you. What's your name again?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Did you ever hear of "The Lone Rider of Santa Fe?"

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: I can't say that I have.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: "Death at the Double X Ranch" - Ra- a-nch.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Must have known I was broke. Even sent me an airplane ticket. It's a shame.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: What are you trying to say?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: ...policemen. I have to call them sheriffs.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: ...a cop. You're a real cop I suppose.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Why don't you catch a few murderers for a change?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Well, you could say that murder was part...

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Going to find me the real criminal? It sounds like one of your stories.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Oh, pinning things on girls now.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: And there was a third man there. I suppose that doesn't sound peculiar to you.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: I'm not interested in whether a racketeer like Lime was killed by his friends or by accident. The only important thing is that he's dead.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: As soon as I get to the bottom of this, I'll get the next plane.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Death is at the bottom of everything, Martins. Leave death to the professionals.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Do you mind if I use that line in my next Western? You can't chuck me out, my papers are in order.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: What do you want to see a doctor for, huh?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Oh, stop behaving like a fool, Martins.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I'm only a little fool - I'm an amateur at it - you're a professional. You've been shaking your cap and bells all over town.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Do you see what that means?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Are you too busy chasing a few tubes of penicillin to investigate a murder?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: That is the racket Harry Lime organized.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Calloway, you haven't shown me one shred of evidence.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I would like a word with this orderly Harbin.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: It's more like a mortuary than police headquarters.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: ...be responsible for you in the streets.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I followed his shadow until suddenly...

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I suppose you don't believe me.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Look...I tell you, you don't think I'm blind, do you?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Yes. Where were you when you saw him first?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I was on that side, the shadow was on that side, and no turnings on either side.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I tell you I heard him running ahead of me.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Yes, yes, yes, and then he vanished out there, I suppose with a puff of smoke and like a clap of...

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: We'll never get him in the Russian zone.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Calloway, you expect too much. I know he deserves to hang, you proved your stuff. But twenty years is a long time - don't ask me to tie the rope.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Oh, there you are. Come in here, there isn't much time.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: She's right. It's none of my business.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Do you mind if I drop off somewhere on the way? I've got an appointment, won't take five minutes...

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Why don't you come in, too - you're a writer... Might interest you.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Paine lent me one of your books; "Oklahoma Kid," I think it was. Read a bit of it... Think it's pretty good. What made you take up this sort of thing? Been doing it for long?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: I never knew there were snake charmers in Texas...

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I'll be your dumb decoy duck.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Calloway, can't you do something about Anna?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: I'll do what I can, if she'll let me.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Wait a minute - let me out.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I haven't got a sensible name, Calloway.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Please be careful, sir. Up we come. Written anything lately?

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: I'm so glad to have met you, sir. I've read quite a few of your books.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: Write her out a receipt, Paine. Give her a receipt for these letters too.

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: You know, Paine's one of your devoted readers. He's promised...

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: I'd like to visit Texas one day, sir.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Shall I go over there, sir?

turns.speaker: CALLOWAY
turns.text: No, no. Leave them for a while.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Get me Major Callaghan on the phone.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Please hurry up - just get him on the telephone.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I'll look it up for you.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Well, look, is there a car here I can use?

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Yes, Cultural re-education Section Propaganda. Very important in a place like this. We do a little show each week. Last week we did "Hamlet" and the week before we had something...

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: I'll tell you what, Mr. Martins. On Wednesday night at our institute, we are having a little lecture on the contemporary novel...I thought perhaps you'd like to speak.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Nonsense. Your novels are very popular here. Aren't they, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: How long can one stay here on this stage money?

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Listen, Mr. Martins, if you'd agree to be our guest, we'd be delighted to have you.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: I know a very good dentist.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I don't need a dentist. Somebody hit me, that's all.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: It was just a soldier. I was trying to punch his major in the eye.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: No, a major, were you really?

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: I've heard of him, of course, but I didn't exactly know him.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I was going to stay with him, but he died Thursday.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Is that what you say to people after death? "Goodness that's awkward..."

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: ...this lecture business, you'll put me up here a while?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: It is, and I'm gunning just the same way for your Major Callaghan.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Hello - Mr. Martins, we tried to get you at your hotel. We have arranged that lecture for tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: On the modern novel - you remember what we arranged and we want you to talk on the Crisis of Faith.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Oh, I thought you would know, you're a writer. Of course you do. Good night, old man.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Well, yes. I suppose that is what I meant to say.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Of course, of course, of course.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Oh, that is Mr. Martins' little joke, of course...

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: The author. Thought you might be interested.

turns.speaker: PAINE
turns.text: Oh, he's very goad, sir. I've read quite a few of his books.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Have you, Sergeant? Author - Martins. Thank you, Sergeant.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Yes, Hindu dances, thank you, Sergeant. This is the first opportunity we've had of making an American author welcome.

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Very popular. Are you staying long?

turns.speaker: CRABBIN
turns.text: Excuse me, have you got tooth...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, well, they seem to've been giving you quite some busy time.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Listen, Harry - I didn't believe that...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's good to see you, Holly.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Tough...tough...Don't worry, old man, they won't hurt her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What can I do, old man, I'm dead, aren't I?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: ...exactly who did you tell about me? Hmm?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: You don't care anything at all about Anna, do you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, I've got quite a lot on my mind.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Do you expect me to give myself up?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's far better thing that I do... Holly, you and I aren't heroes, the world doesn't make any heroes...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Outside of your stories...I've got to be careful.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm only safe in the Russian Zone... I'm safe as long as they can use me...

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: As long as they can use you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I wish I could get rid of this thing.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't try to be a policeman, old man.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: What did you expect me to be - part of your...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Part? You can have any part you want, so long as you don't interfere...I have never cut you out of anything yet.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: I remember when they raided the gambling joint - you know a safe way out...

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Have you ever seen any of your victims?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Do you know, I don't ever feel comfortable on these sort of things...Victims?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Mr. Martins. Delighted to meet you. Come let's sit down here. Ober! Zwei. What would you like. Tea? Coffee?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: It's wonderful how you keep the tension.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: At the end of every chapter --

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: We came out of his place like this, and were walking this way. A friend of his called to him from over there. Harry went across and from up there came the truck. It was just about here.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: But he said he died instantaneously.

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Well, there was only you, and this friend of his. Who is he?

turns.speaker: MARTINS
turns.text: Not necessarily. She'd probably want to help.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: What's the good of another post mortem? Suppose you dig up something - well - discreditable to Harry?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I live in the Russian sector, but you'll find me at the Casanova Club every night. One has to work...
